com.topcoder.util.sql.databaseabstraction
Class DatabaseAbstractor

java.lang.Object
  com.topcoder.util.sql.databaseabstraction.DatabaseAbstractor
public class DatabaseAbstractor
extends java.lang.Object

The DatabaseAbstractor class permits a factory type pattern to be used for creation of CustomResultSets. This class is simply a storage facility for a mapper and an on-demand mapper, both of which it passes to any CustomResultSets that is creates.

In version 1.1, instance of OnDemandMapper is added to covert the mapping when original or mapped value is not of the desired type to get.

Thread Safety: - This class is mutable, and not thread-safe.

Typical usage:

               ResultSet rs = <<Get Database ResultSet>>;
               DatabaseAbstractor databaseAbstractor = new DatabaseAbstractor();
               Mapper mapper = <<Create Mapper>>
               OnDemandMapper onDemandMapper = OnDemandMapper.createDefaultOnDemandMapper();
               databaseAbstractor.setMapper(mapper);
               databaseAbstractor.setOnDemandMapper(onDemandMapper);
               CustomResultSet customRS = databaseAbstractor.convertResultSet(rs);
               while(customRS.next()){
                       customRS.getLong("columnName");
                       customRS.getString("columnName2");
               }

Since:
1.0
Version:
1.1
Author:
argolite,WishingBone, aubergineanode,justforplay

public DatabaseAbstractor()

Creates a new DatabaseAbstractor which does no mapping.

DatabaseAbstractor

public DatabaseAbstractor(Mapper mapper)

Create a new DatabaseAbstractor that uses the given mapper.

Parameters:
mapper - The provider of explicit mapper - may be null

DatabaseAbstractor

public DatabaseAbstractor(Mapper mapper,
                          OnDemandMapper onDemandMapper)
Creates a new DatabaseAbstractor that uses the given onDemandMapper for doing dynamic conversion of data and the given mapper for explicit column value conversion.

Parameters:
mapper - The explicit mappers to apply. Can be null
onDemandMapper - the on-demand conversion provider. Can be null
Since:
1.1
Method Detail

convertResultSet

public CustomResultSet convertResultSet(java.sql.ResultSet rs)
                                 throws IllegalMappingException,
                                        java.sql.SQLException

Convert result set to a CustomResultSet. Create a new CustomResultset using rs, and the dataTypeMapper and onDemandMapper fields.

In version1.1, pre-initialized OnDemandMapper is used to do dynamic conversion.

Parameters:
rs - the result set to be converted
Returns:
the custom result set
Throws:
IllegalMappingException - when mapping is illegal
java.sql.SQLException - if SQL exception takes place
java.lang.NullPointerException - if rs is null.

convertResultSet

public CustomResultSet convertResultSet(java.sql.ResultSet rs,
                                        Mapper mapper)
                                 throws IllegalMappingException,
                                        java.sql.SQLException

Convert result set with specified mapper. Create a new CustomResultSet using the rs and mapper parameters and the onDemandMapper field.

In version1.1, pre-initialized OnDemandMapper is used to do dynamic conversion.

Parameters:
rs - the result set to be converted
mapper - the mapper specified
Returns:
the custom result set
Throws:
IllegalMappingException - when mapping is illegal
java.sql.SQLException - if SQL exception takes place
java.lang.NullPointerException - if rs is null.

getMapper

public Mapper getMapper()
Get the mapper for explicit conversions. Null indicates that no specific conversions will be done.

Returns:
the mapper

setMapper

public void setMapper(Mapper mapper)
Set the explicit mapping mapper to the given value. Null indicates that no mapper should be used in the future.

Parameters:
mapper - The mapper, which may be null

setOnDemandMapper

public void setOnDemandMapper(OnDemandMapper onDemandMapper)
Set the on-demand mapping provider to the given value. Null indicates that created CustomResultSets should not support on-demand conversion.

Parameters:
onDemandMapper - The mapper, which may be null
Since:
1.1

getOnDemandMapper

public OnDemandMapper getOnDemandMapper()
Gets the on-demand mapping provider. A return of null indicates that no on-demand mapping will be done in created result sets.

Returns:
The on demand mapper
Since:
1.1
